```java
FileOutputStream fos = new FileOutputStream("file.txt", true);
Cipher cipher = Cipher.getInstance("AES");
cipher.init(Cipher.ENCRYPT_MODE, key);
CipherOutputStream cos = new CipherOutputStream(fos, cipher);
cos.write("some data".getBytes());
cos.close();
```

<<<explanation>>>: You can use RandomAccessFile.write to append to an encrypted file. However, you will need to decrypt the file before you can append to it. The CipherOutputStream does not support seeking, so you cannot directly append to the middle of the file. You would need to decrypt the entire file, append to it, and then re-encrypt it.

Note: If you control the output data size and it is divisible by the block size, you can use NoPadding. But this will require you to manually manage the padding.

Also, be aware that if you are using a CipherOutputStream, you will need to flush the stream after each write to ensure that the data is encrypted before it is written to the file.

Lastly, remember to close the CipherOutputStream when you are done writing to the file. Failing to do so may result in data corruption.
